result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell V Mcdade

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Russell V Mcdade appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Russell V Mcdade.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing/Final PreTrial with Defendant's other case, 21CF1680 (represented by Attorney Levine). Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material; however, has NOT received an offer from the State. Defense was recently appointed to Defendant's homicide case, 22CF3447, pending in Branch 34. 

Regarding Case 21CF1680: For reasons stated on the record regarding conflicts, Court GRANTED Attorney Levine's Motion to Withdraw and APPOINTED Attorney Thomas Harris at COUNTY EXPENSE. Attorney Harris accepted appointment on Case 21CF1680; however, has to do further review and determine whether he has any conflicts. 

Court VACATED Jury Trial date of December 5, 2022. 

Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Defense Demand for Discovery and Inspection; received and filed.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed and filed. 
Attorney Thomas Harris

Defendant Russell V Mcdade in Court, in custody.  Attorney Michael G. Levine in Court for Russell V Mcdade.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing with Defendant's other case, 21CF1680 (represented by Attorney Levine). Conference held in chambers. Discussion placed on the record. Court addressed Defendant's homicide case and potential conflicts. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Attorney Givens' Motion to Withdraw from CASE 22CF1128. Attorney Levine will continue to review Case 21CF1680 and determine whether he has to withdraw. 

For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris (present via Zoom) to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant is NOT REQUIRED to reimburse Milwaukee County; however, Court ordered the Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade not in court, in custody.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr appeared by video for Russell V Mcdade.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Hearing held off the Record via Zoom Video Conference. 
Case in Court for Motion hearing with Defendant's other case 21CF1680. Defendant was not produced. State requested case be rescheduled for an in-person hearing. Case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Hearing will be IN PERSON in room 113 of Safety Building. Status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Case 22CF1128: Motion to Withdraw hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Hearing will be held / Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. 
Information provided to Deputy in Courtroom. 
Additionally, parties will address Final PreTrial date.

-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Clerk contacted the parties via email to schedule hearing.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade in court with attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Russell V Mcdade in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Defendants other case, 21CF1680.  Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. State advised the Court of possible Joinder Motion. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 46.Court ordered State to file Joinder Motion by October 7, 2022. Court ordered Defense to file Response by October 31, 2022. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  Final PreTrial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade in court with attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Russell V Mcdade in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: P.O. Matthew Rosen - MPD. Court took judicial notice of defendant's pending Milwaukee County case 21CF1680, Sheboygan case 21CF528 and prior adjudication regarding case 19JV904.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade in Court with Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens.  Defendant Russell V Mcdade in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Defendant and Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant also has Case 21CF1680 pending in Branch 46. Conference held in chambers. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Givens was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Treyvontae M.L.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Russell V Mcdade in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Russell V Mcdade in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Russell V Mcdade appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.  AS TO COUNTS 5 and 6:  Motion to dismiss by the defense.   Arguments heard.   Court DENIED motion as to Count 6 and GRANTED motion as to Count 5.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 7.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
